2623402968F64688BDCB985BD55F10A1.description: develop personal and collective visions of national identity

2E39D696AE3941AC8CB2C96F7AACC6BA.description: analyze various perspectives of future visions of Canada (pluralism, multination model, separatism, Aboriginal self-determination, global leadership, North American integration)

A6AB2617DCF8436F9EF90DE818F2CD84.description: explore the challenges and opportunities associated with the promotion of Canadian national unity (Québec sovereignty, federal-provincial-territorial relations, Aboriginal self-determination and land claims, bilingualism, multiculturalism)

55A25D499FB94CE2986B9290379A490D.description: identify historical perspectives of Canada as a nation (Louis LaFontaine and Robert Baldwin, the Fathers of Confederation, First Nations treaties and the Indian Act, Métis and Inuit self-governance, Louis Riel, French Canadian nationalism, Pierre Trudeau, National Indian Brotherhood)

50713AE9A9884DDC8EB4ED47ABF232F2.description: examine methods used by individuals, groups and governments in Canada to promote a national identity (symbolism, mythology, institutions, government programs and initiatives)

39A844C4E415460092CA7194263F470E.description: explore multiple perspectives on national identity in Canada

98030ADCED8C49C496545AEDEE474563.description: respect the views of others on alternative visions of national identity

4F8173F505B740E1AE4E595E1B411A48.description: appreciate contrasting historical and contemporary narratives associated with national identity

403F64EDCAE54CCB809E5186B890FCC1.description: appreciate historical and contemporary attempts to develop a national identity

40FB431E1DFE4341A0A38E31ED0FEE1A.description: Students will understand the complexities of nationalism within the Canadian context.

E27E54004D10455DABBF5A0F336F8194.description: Should individuals and groups in Canada embrace a national identity?

C5921D4FB08F41189B31FC8C341A99B2.description: evaluate the extent to which nationalism must be sacrificed in the interest of internationalism

37D62793FFD94ED9889D8E001FD41B2D.description: examine impacts of the pursuit of internationalism in addressing contemporary global issues (conflict, poverty, debt, disease, environment, human rights)

00DC44CC1D8E484DA9C63140DD0FE9CC.description: analyze the extent to which selected organizations promote internationalism (United Nations, World Council of Indigenous Peoples, European Union, l'Organisation internationale de la Francophonie, Arctic Council)

2EF8F9AE61D2496F9026A9268CFBC01D.description: examine how internationalism can be promoted by foreign policy (multilateralism, supranationalism, peacekeeping, foreign aid, international law and agreements)

E21163F47A9C4ABBA369BED833859785.description: analyze the motives of nation and state involvement or noninvolvement in international affairs (economic stability, self-determination, peace, security, humanitarianism)

E48A3BF4BD9A43BBB0B768EA6C6FE9F3.description: demonstrate a global consciousness with respect to the human condition and global affairs

7506EAE046304C5C93B651885A3C0448.description: appreciate the impacts of nation and state involvement in regional and global affairs on individual and collective identities

1091CC1769E94701BC2B0512159482AC.description: appreciate that nations and states engage in regional and global affairs for a variety of reasons

894765C1989F4EA29258E9056B1E4C4C.description: Students will assess impacts of the pursuit of internationalism in contemporary global affairs.

2E694F713089459AAB91AB41DC5BE96E.description: evaluate impacts of the pursuit of national self-determination (Québecois nationalism and sovereignty movement; First Nations, Métis and Inuit self-government; contemporary examples)

2124D97A8D0A411386606FC985B8927A.description: examine ultranationalism as a cause of genocide (the Holocaust, the 1932-1933 famine in Ukraine, contemporary examples)

716AA8CA307B47C0AD4D436A218B107A.description: analyze nationalism and ultranationalism during times of conflict (causes of the First and Second World Wars, examples of nationalism and ultranationalism from the First and Second World Wars, internments in Canada, conscription crises)

AF44F4BF09A9465EB066B90E5A6C605E.description: examine similarities and differences between nationalism and ultranationalism

48EE8AA7084F46CFA582061EECAC66F3.description: examine how the pursuit of national interest shapes foreign policy (First World War peace settlements, the interwar period)

57DBDA38F29647B59FBC85B09F5EFD49.description: explore the relationship between nationalism and the pursuit of national interest

34C709D5B7E0458E9B006A4F627E6AB4.description: explore the concept of national interest

D5FAC30B656B4878B7C7ABF7A8B768AD.description: appreciate multiple perspectives related to the pursuit of national interest

39A6B615A623401D9D9137E21EC525B6.description: appreciate that the pursuit of national interest has positive and negative consequences

981353AEB28C43588AA69B0D4B169E72.description: appreciate that nations and states pursue national interest

2AFE157CDC974CBD8CC8F8D2477B28E7.description: Students will understand impacts of nationalism, ultranationalism and the pursuit of national interest.

F3CA0289161D4C91B3F95CBA8C091EB8.description: analyze the importance of reconciling nationalism with contending non-nationalist loyalties (religion, region, culture, race, ideology, class, other contending loyalties)

B2517702D03246649184D68071891761.description: analyze the importance of reconciling contending nationalist loyalties (Canadian nationalism, First Nations and Métis nationalism, ethnic nationalism in Canada, Québecois nationalism, Inuit perspectives on nationalism)

BF016959056240B882C8736258660022.description: examine nationalism as an identity, internalized feeling and/or collective consciousness shared by a people (French Revolution, Canadian nationalism, Québecois nationalism, First Nations and Métis nationalism, Inuit perspectives)

E7BE726305414FFCA0582AEE57FFB82C.description: examine how the development of nationalism is shaped by historical, geographic, political, economic and social factors (French Revolution, contemporary examples)

41F86BD703C24357835B40F3CE0BF67E.description: examine the relationship between nation and nation-state

22E28E0E9F444298BA17DBEF1C4F6D16.description: develop understandings of nation and nationalism (relationship to land, geographic, collective, civic, ethnic, cultural, linguistic, political, spiritual, religious, patriotic)

1F6312256F2F480FB13DD85745539F0D.description: explore a range of expressions of nationalism

17E912B3B2034377974E721CE0710A38.description: appreciate why peoples seek to promote their identity through nationalism

51384820ACA24341B947AEC027E2C06B.description: appreciate how the forces of nationalism have shaped, and continue to shape, Canada and the world

E1A4758A81EC425998F7D7C36BD56DC3.description: appreciate the existence of alternative views on the meaning of nation

9FE02910177B44279233E37D91B2B49D.description: Students will explore the relationships among identity, nation and nationalism

764F82DF1F2F4AF1B08D521EFAC244E4.description: Should nation be the foundation of identity?

7182BB04E8C94268B553460E818D6A34.description: To what extent should we embrace nationalism?
